content.question: Parker has a part-time job picking apples. Let the random variable <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of baskets of apples picked each day. The distribution of <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has mean 4.5 baskets and standard deviation 1.3 baskets. Parker is paid $65 per day plus $5 per basket. What are the mean <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of Parker’s daily pay?

choices.label: <math alttext="mu equals 87.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>87.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma equals 71.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>71.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="mu equals 87.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>87.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma equals 6.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>6.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="mu equals 22.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>22.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma equals 6.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>6.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="mu equals 87.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>87.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma equals 1.30 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>1.30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="mu equals 22.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>22.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma equals 71.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>71.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="mu equals 87.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>87.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma equals 6.50 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>6.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
